info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Hamilton, west central Warren, central Fulton, northwestern Saratoga and southern Herkimer Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 129 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms from near Lewey Lake Campground to 8 miles southwest of Lake Pleasant to near Newport. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Herkimer, Little Falls, Speculator, Johnsburg, Dolgeville, Northville, Lake Pleasant, Wells, Newport, Stratford, Middleville, Day Center, Moffitt Beach Campground, Caroga Lake, Caroga Lake Public Campground, Sacandaga Campground, Oppenheim, Fairfield, Thurman and Stony Creek. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 29A. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for eastern and east central New York.
